required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evidence of a Redox-dependent Regulation of Immune Responses to Exercise-Induced Inflammation

lead_sponsor.agency: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

clinical_study.source: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

brief_summary.textblock: In this investigation the investigators utilized N-acetylcysteine (NAC) supplementation to enhance reduced glutathione (GSH) stores during an 8-day recovery period from a strenuous eccentric exercise protocol in order to test the hypotheses: i) redox status perturbations in skeletal muscle are pivotal for the immune responses and ii) antioxidant supplementation may alter immune cell responses following exercise-induced muscle microtrauma.

detailed_description.textblock:
The major thiol-disulfide couple of GSH and oxidized glutathione (GSSG) is a crucial regulator of the main transcriptional pathways regulating aseptic inflammation and recovery of skeletal muscle following aseptic injury. Antioxidant supplementation may hamper exercise-induced inflammatory responses.
The objective was to examine how thiol-based antioxidant supplementation affects immune mobilization following exercise-induced skeletal muscle microtrauma. In a two-trial, double-blind, crossover, repeated measures design, 10 young men received either placebo or NAC (20 mg/kg/day) immediately after a muscle-damaging exercise protocol (300 eccentric contractions) and for eight consecutive days. Blood sampling and performance assessment were performed pre-exercise, 2h post-exercise and daily for 8 consecutive days.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in protein carbonyls in red blood cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 consecutive days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Concentration of protein carbonyls

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in thiobarbituric acid reactive substances in red blood cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 consecutive days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Thiobarbituric acid reactive substances concentration in red blood cells

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in total antioxidant capacity in serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 consecutive days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in reduced glutathione in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 consecutive days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Concentration of reduced glutathione in red blood cells

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in oxidized glutathione in blood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 consecutive days post-exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of maximal knee extensor eccentric peak torque on an isokinetic dynamometer at 60o/s.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in delayed onset of muscle soreness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 consecutive days post-exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the delayed onset of muscle soreness by palpation of the vastus lateralis and rectus femoris following a squat motion
Measurement of body composition by Dual Emission X-ray Absorptiometry (DXA)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One day before exercise and daily for 8 consecutive days post-exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of dietary intake with emphasis on antioxidant element intake

arm_group.description: orally in three daily dosages, at 20 mg/kg/day, daily for eight days after exercise
orally in three daily dosages, content: 500 mL drink that contained water (375 mL), sugar-free cordial (125 ml), and 2 g of low-calorie glucose/dextrose powder

intervention.description: 20 mg//kg/day, orally, daily for eight days following exercise
500 mL orally, daily for eight days following exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Recreationally trained (VO2max > 45 ml/kg/min)
- Engaged in regular exercise for ≥3 times/week for > 12 months
- non-smokers
- Abstain from exercise during the course of the two trials
- No consumption of performance-enhancing substances, antioxidants, caffeine, alcohol and/or medications during the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- NAC intolerance
- Recent musculoskeletal injuries of the lower limbs
- Febrile illness
- History of muscle lesion.
